Text:
"Tom Palmer, editor of "After the Welfare State," says young people must save for their own future because the money promised them by politicians will be long gone by the time they retire."

Right. The young do not have that kind of money so this is delusional propaganda for the rich. 

Didn't succeed in saving up money? Don't blame the rich who fucking own everything, even DC.

"Right. The young do not have that kind of money"

Because they have to pay for the costly welfare state that won't be there for them when they're old ?
Where is the Stossel broadcast October 11? According to JohnStossel website, subject was WINNING THE PRESIDENCY.

20121011 was advertised @EdgarS789, you're correct. But 'ell if I could find it. It's advertised timeslots on FBN that night and on FNC that weekend were blotted out with other FBN and FNC debate related analysis content. I think it may have been silently dropped.

Halbermunken:  Why don't you calculate how much you'd save for your retirement if you got to keep and invest all the money that the government steals from you every year...  (Yes, you can hire a South Korean third grader to help you with the math.)  And government regulations have tremendous side-effects that skyrocket retirement costs: non-market health-care prices, property taxes, etc.  People can pool risks through non-profit mutual aid societies and other voluntary organizations.
